en.sc1: Insertion sort works by maintaining a sorted portion of the array so far, demarcated by the fill index, and inserting the next value into the correct position within that sorted portion.
en.sc2: The outer for loop starts with considering record in position 1, as the record in position 0 is already 'sorted.'
en.sc3: We begin by saving the next value to insert in the variable nextValue.
en.sc4: We then enter a second loop to compare nextValue to the value to its left, and if it is smaller, we move the larger value one position to the right to make room for the next value.
en.sc5: Since 10 is less than 20, we move 20 one position to the right to make room for 10.
en.sc6: We're now at the beginning of the array, so we can insert nextValue in position 0.
en.sc7: Now we have two sorted values. The next iteration of the outer loop will consider the next fill position in the array, and we will repeat the process.
en.sc9: We compare 15 to the value to its left, 20. Since 15 is less than 20, we move 20 one position to the right to make room for 15.
en.sc10: Since 15 is greater than 10, we are done with this iteration of the inner loop, and we can insert 15 in position 1.
en.sc11: Now we have three sorted values. Continue to repeat the process for the next value in the array at fill position 3.
en.sc13: We compare 54 to the value to its left, 20. Since 54 is greater than 20, it doesn't move, and we can 'insert' 54 in position 3.
en.sc14: Now we have four sorted values. Continue to repeat the process until the entire array is sorted.
